paragraph.heading: 1Deploying ENViSioN! Projects
paragraph.paragraph:
Deploying an ENViSioN! project or a number of ENViSioN! projects is made simple through using the
/10_Developing\10_Getting_Started\10_Using_ENViSioN\10_Adding_A_New_Project\deployment_wizard.xml Deployment Project Wizard in the
/10_Developing\10_Getting_Started\10_Using_ENViSioN\10_Adding_A_New_Project\index.xml Add New Project Dialog .
paragraph.heading: 2Deployment Checklist
paragraph.paragraph: Before choosing to deploy your ENViSioN! project(s) please use this checklist to ensure that you project(s) can be deployed successfully. Ensure that...

list.item: All project dependencies are compiled for all projects that are to be deployed
The ENViSioN! project(s)have been successfully compiled
If the deployment is a release deployment then the dependencies and ENViSioN! projects have been compiled in the Release or the equivalent configuration mode.

paragraph.heading: 2Merge Modules
paragraph.paragraph:
The Deployment Project Wizard creates a new Visual Studio.NET Merge Module project when it is completed. This is for connivances purposes as Visual Studio.NET comescomplete with a Merge Module compatible installation setup software. The merge module project may then be modified to suit the particular deployment solution. For more information see the
/10_Developing\10_Getting_Started\10_Using_ENViSioN\10_Adding_A_New_Project\deployment_wizard.xml Deployment Project Wizard .
paragraph.heading: 2Not Using A Merge Module
paragraph.paragraph:
If your deployment solution does not support merge modules, or you want to do a simply deploy such as archiving the project assemblies and dependant files then this is alsomade possible through the Deployment wizard. The wizard actually copies all of the assemblies to the location specified when selecting the Deployment wizard from the Add New Project Dialog. For more information seethe
/10_Developing\10_Getting_Started\10_Using_ENViSioN\10_Adding_A_New_Project\deployment_wizard.xml Deployment Project Wizard .
